body:
After a successful run of `helm init`, the following message is displayed:

    Please note: by default, Tiller is deployed with an insecure 'allow unauthenticated users' policy.
    For more information on securing your installation see: https://docs.helm.sh/using_helm/#securing-your-helm-installation

I took this to mean that my specific installation was insecure, even after following the specified instructions.  But after reading the source, I see this message is displayed unconditionally, even if the proper security configuration is provided.  I would suggest hiding this message when the proper/secure configuration is provided.

It might also be worth clarifying the message, as it's not entirely clear to me exactly what section of the linked doc it is referring to.

For reference, my actual `helm init` command which generated the output:

    helm init \
        --tiller-tls \
        --tiller-tls-cert ${tmp}/tiller.cert.pem \
        --tiller-tls-key ${tmp}/tiller.key.pem \
        --tls-ca-cert ${HELMHOME}/ca.pem \
        --tiller-tls-verify \
        --service-account=tiller

I suggest hiding this message when `--tiller-tls-verify` is enabled (assuming my
